RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Government: United States Department of Homeland Security

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: court official responsible for the report and recommendation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Conducted the interview with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., ensured he understood his Miranda rights, and obtained a waiver before proceeding with questioning. Also involved in the stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Police Department: local law enforcement agency involved in the traffic stop and investigation of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court where motions to suppress were filed and heard for Defendants RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth: rental car company whose vehicles were used by smugglers, often preferred because if caught, they would only lose a rental car, not one of their own vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: government agency responsible for enforcing immigration laws and conducting investigations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals: a court that has noted the order of vehicles in a smuggling venture is not significant
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: geographical boundary used as a factor in determining reasonable suspicion for United States Border Patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Echo 43 checkpoint: checkpoint on Highway 59 where United States Border Patrol agents were stationed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: the highest court in the land that has long held that reasonableness is the touchstone of analysis
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol station: location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was transported for questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Constitution: supreme law of the land that outlines the framework of the US government and the relationship between the government and its citizens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.law enforcement officer: official responsible for enforcing laws and maintaining public order
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the events are taking place
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who encountered illegals in a white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and was unaware of Corinth, Texas location at the time of stop.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ford Motor Company: a truck manufacturer that produces models such as the Ford F-150 and Ford F-250
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: vehicle stopped by Agent Trevino on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting illegals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who testified during cross-examination about his lack of knowledge regarding the Moglia ranch house and Stag trailer occupants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who conducted the initial traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reyes and Hugo Benavides: officers who recalled the timing of their arrival during a traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: vehicle driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and subject to a canine search
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Benavides: United States Border Patrol agent who asked IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. questions en route to the United States Border Patrol station
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: United States Magistrate Judge who does not consider the fact that the black Dodge pickup truck was riding low as contributing to reasonable suspicion for a traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: state agency responsible for preparing district traffic maps and determining traffic flow data
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Lare: division of the Texas Department of Transportation that collected and determined traffic flow data for Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz: rental car company with locations at airports
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge truck: vehicle believed to be connected to the white Malibu sedan, as both were riding in tandem south on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and had passed through Dallas, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road where Agent Trevino initiated a stop of the white Malibu sedan and where the black Dodge truck was also spotted
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol, Freer immig: checkpoint where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was transported for further questioning and placed in a holding cell
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59: highway where the traffic stop occurred
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville checkpoint: checkpoint on Highway 359 that smugglers attempt to bypass by using alternative routes such as 'the loop'
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 359: highway with a checkpoint that smugglers attempt to bypass by using alternative routes such as 'the loop'
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway near the location of the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who encountered illegals in a white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and was unaware of Corinth, Texas location at the time of stop.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol and Freer Po: law enforcement agencies involved in the traffic stop and investigation of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.District Judge: judge with authority to review and decide on motions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: road located near the wind farm on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol agents: agents who encounter illegal aliens wearing caps after walking through the brush. They are also familiar with local vehicles and recognize approximately 90-95% of them as belonging to farmers and oil field workers.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: checkpoint on Highway 59 that smugglers try to avoid by using alternative routes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett Road: dirt road which intersects Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and travels eastward, approximately five miles south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hugo Benavides: United States Border Patrol agent who participated in the traffic stop and investigation of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
